revision.comment: clean up, Infobox parameter standardisation using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (8707)
revision.text:
{{Infobox football biography | name = Mike Turner | image = | fullname = Michael George Elliott Turner | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=y|1938|9|20}} | birth_place = [[Bridport]], [[Dorset]], [[England]] | death_date = | height = | position = Goalkeeper | years1 = -1961 | years2 = 1961-1964 | years3 = 1964-1966 | clubs1 = [[Dorchester Town F.C.|Dorchester Town]] | clubs2 = [[Swindon Town F.C.|Swindon Town]] | clubs3 = [[Torquay United F.C.|Torquay United]] | caps1 = ? | caps2 = 75 | caps3 = 14 | goals1 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | goals3 = 0 }} '''Michael George Elliott Turner''' (born 20 September 1938 in [[Bridport]], [[Dorset]]) is an [[England|English]] former professional [[Association football|football]] goalkeeper.
==Football career==
He was capped by [[England national football team|England]] at youth level, but due to service in the [[RAF]] had to wait until December 1961 to turn professional when he joined [[Swindon Town F.C.|Swindon Town]] from non-league [[Dorchester Town F.C.|Dorchester Town]]. He played 75 league games for Swindon and was part of Swindon's first ever promotion winning team in the 1962-63 season, before joining [[Torquay United F.C.|Torquay United]] in July 1964. He played 14 league games for Torquay over the next 2 seasons, before leaving the professional game.
He subsequently returned to [[Dorset]], working for [[Plessey]]s for 20 years before retiring (in October 2006 he was living in [[Poole]]).<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/wiltshire/content/articles/2006/10/05/stfc_b_051006_feature.shtml STFC's first-ever promotion]</ref>
Turner is married with two children<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/devon/have_your_say/friends_family.shtml Make contact with friends and family]</ref>
